cyclone.name: SALLY
cyclone.current_location: about 55 mi (90 km) southeast of Naples, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to turn WNW then NW across the east-central Gulf of Mexico, aiming for the north-central Gulf Coast (southeastern Louisiana to Mississippi/Alabama).
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: north-central Gulf Coast, likely between southeast Louisiana and coastal Mississippi

weather_observation.watch_coast: Ochlockonee River FL to Okaloosa/Walton County Line FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire northern Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana to the Florida Panhandle
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds (35–45 mph) possible at the port late Monday into early Tuesday, with higher gusts.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Potential surge of 2–4 ft along the southeast Louisiana coast, including Plaquemines Parish.
weather_observation.rainfall: 2–4 inches with isolated amounts up to 6 inches could fall over the port area Monday-Tuesday.
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents and a low risk of isolated tornadoes in rainbands.
